reviewText: It may be that my stereo system is less than magnificent.  This CD is just not very attractive on my machine.  Given the inspiring quality of Anglican choirs throughout the world, I found this disappointing.  To my own ear, it didn't even sound as if all the voices were hitting true notes.  Undoubtedly this is a fine act of worship and will count as an appropriate joyful noise to the Lord.  Here, to me, the "noise" part reckons more than it should.  It could just be my machine.
How nice to be able to take a wonderful and inspiring service along on my travels in rush hour traffic.

The choir of old Christ Church sings by candlelight and has caught the power and beauty of this ancient monastic service of prayer wonderfully.  I could go to bed peacefully viewing this every night.  Thank you, thank you.  (FYI: you can find a couple of tracks from this DVD on youtube under Christ Church Compline.)

I used to attend this service weekly at St. Mark's Cathedral in Seattle. Since moving back home I've missed it tremendously. Hearing and seeing this service again brought back many fond memories. What a splendid way to end the day. Now I can enjoy Compline whenever I please. I also found some goodies on the history behind Compline on the video I hope to share with my rector. Perhaps it will inspire him too to start up a Compline service at our local parish church. Cambridge Singers - Lighten our Darkness (2 CD)Music for Compline Brother Sun, Sister Moon Vespers And Compline Vespers and Compline Gregorian Chants: The Best of the Benedictine Monks of St. Michael's
